full_text: Soly Melamed, M.D. General Practice 436 N. Bedford Drive, Suite 303 1030 S. Glendale Ave. Suite 405 Beverly Hills, CA 90210 Glendale, CA 91205 (310) 859-0853 (24 HRS.) Fax: (818) 243-3368 (818) 241-4162 (9 TO 5) QUESTION # 3 RE: FADUMA ADEN WARSAME The Prognosis remains guarded even under close medical treatment and supervision. In addition, the patient has been suffering from Arthritis since 20 years ago and she had hip replacement and she is on wheelchair now and her mobility is limited. Additionally, the patient suffers from heart disease and she is under medical treatment. The patient also suffers from Amaurotic right eye problem (blindness). The patient is taking multiple medications that interfere with her memory, as; Megace (weakness), Hydergin (Senile Dementia), Exelon (Senile Dementia), Klonopin (nervousness), Ambien (sleep disorder) Her condition is resistant to medications. Due to the above medical and psychological disorder, the patient is unable to attend the English language classes, and it is impossible for her to pass the English language tests and U.S. History and Civics. However, Mrs. Faduma, is aware of the nature and importance of pledging an oath and understands the consequences of proclaiming her allegiance to the United States of America. Soly Melamed, M. D. SOLY MELAMED, M.D. 1030 S. Glendale Ave., #405 Glendale, CA 91205 Tel: (818) 241-4162
